title: Drawing, "Spoons", 1825–50
medium: Pen, sepia, brush, gray water color
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: The handle is terminating at the front with the mask of a bearded man, crowned by a diadem.  At the sides are the transformed ears, which support a drapery festoon.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Spoons", 1825–50.
1825–50. Pen, sepia, brush, gray water color. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-5498.
